wikipedia_page.main: Stephen Scholey (22 January 1815 – 13 May 1878) was a Member of the Legislative Assembly of the British colony of New South Wales, Australia.  He was born in Garden street, Holbeck village, near Leeds, West Riding of Yorkshire, England, and died at East Maitland, New South Wales.

response: John was the son of a Leeds businessman, Stephen Scholey (1815–1878) who entered the service of the Colonial Office in New South Wales, and was a Member of the New South Wales Legislative Assembly for East Maitland. John's mother was Anne SpinkScrap album containing newsclippings and notes c.1878–1967  Newcastle University Cultural Collections, The Mayfield Website. John appears in the 1851 Census Return at 27 Trafalgar Street, Leeds, aged 11, with his parents and his sister Mary Ann.

Until his death he maintained a continual correspondence with his family in Yorkshire, notably his first cousin, Stephen Scholey, a Professor of Musicref:A7769(iii)  also born in Holbeck, who resided in Hunslet, and who outlived John.Recorded in the 1881 Census as a Professor of Music, resident at 13 Dunston Street, Hunset, West Riding, Yorkshire; still there when the 1911 Census was taken.

Electoral results for the district of East Maitland

response: A by-election was held for the New South Wales Legislative Assembly electorate of East Maitland on 5 June 1878 because of the death of Stephen Scholey.
